documents.title: Storm Damage Assessment Protocol — Pine plantation
documents.text: This SOP applies to pine plantation operations in India and should be used when a field note indicates issues related to storm & damage assessment. When severe damage threshold reaches 10% or photos per block exceeds 4locations, trigger the response steps below. Step 1: Update hazard signage and document the observation with photos and a short note; focus on block, stems, canopy, skid trails. Step 2: Escalate for replant assessment; if the issue is localized, mark boundaries using GPS waypoints and notify the block supervisor. Step 3: Perform a safety scan; re-check the site after 37 hours and record before/after measurements. Step 4: Clear access roads first; if conditions persist, escalate to the regional operations lead and create a ticket with timestamps. Always follow PPE requirements, keep an audit trail of changes, and avoid actions that could contaminate waterways or increase fire risk. Record: region=India, asset=Pine plantation, category=Storm & damage assessment, incident_ref=INC-00001.
